intro: Bremontiera, commonly known as the "false holly," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It consists of a single species, Bremontiera excelsa, native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
